intro: Ilex charrascosensis, commonly known as the Charrasco holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves with spiny margins. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
